meanings.definition: To make a conical hole in (a material) to allow the head of a screw or bolt to lie flush with or below the surface.
meanings.sent1: I need to countersink the screws into the wood to avoid any protrusions.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter will countersink the screws to ensure a smooth finish on the furniture.
meanings.sent3: The handyman decided to countersink the screws so the table wouldn't wobble.
meanings.sent4: She carefully countersunk the screws, embedding them neatly into the metal.
meanings.sent5: To create a professional look, always countersink the screws when assembling furniture.

meanings.definition: A conical hole made in a material to allow the head of a screw or bolt to lie flush with or below the surface.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used a countersink to create a clean finish on the wood.
meanings.sent2: Make sure the countersink is deep enough for the screw head to sit perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The tiny mouse peeked out from the countersink in the wall, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: The countersink in the metal resembled a small, hidden well for the screws.
meanings.sent5: The countersink in the wood was so precise that the screw head disappeared seamlessly.
